BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CENTER FOR ADVANCED STUDIES IN BUSINESS

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO STIMULATE THE CONTINUAL PROCESS OF PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION, TO PROMOTE THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS, AND TO ADVANCE THE WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF BUSINESS AND OTHER ACADEMIC UNITS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: A. TO STIMULATE THE CONTINUAL PROCESS OF PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION IN BUSINESS AND ADMINISTRATION AT THE WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF BUSINESS AND OTHER ACADEMIC UNITS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN-MADISON (UNIVERSITY) IN THE STUDENT, ALUMNUS AND THE PRACTITIONER PHASES. B. TO PROMOTE THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS BETWEEN THE STUDENT BODY, ALUMNI AND FACULTY OF THE WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF BUSINESS, OTHER ACADEMIC UNITS AT THE UNIVERSITY AND INTERESTED EXECUTIVES AND ADMINISTRATORS. C. TO ADVANCE THE SCHOOL OF BUSINESS AND OTHER ACADEMIC UNITS AT THE UNIVERSITY BY DISSEMINATING INFORMATION CONCERNING STUDENT, ALUMNI, FACULTY AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.Desc: THE FLUNO CENTER: A FULL IMMERSION EXECUTIVE EDUCATION FACILITY THAT IS OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE CENTER FOR ADVANCED STUDIES IN BUSINESS, INC. (CASB), PROVIDED CONFERENCE SERVICES, LODGING AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO SUPPORT ITS EDUCATIONAL EVENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAMS: FULL IMMERSION EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS (P.L.R. #98-24048). CASB CUSTOM PROGRAM OFFERINGS EXTEND TO ALL FUNCTIONAL AREAS AND LEVELS WITHIN AN ORGANIZATION. CONSULTING IS OFFERED BOTH ADJACENT TO THE PROGRAMMATIC OFFER AS WELL AS MORE GENERALLY WITHIN TOPICS RELATED TO HUMAN CAPITAL. CASB RUNS A PORTFOLIO OF OPEN-ENROLLMENT COURSES ON VARIOUS BUSINESS RELATED TOPICS. CASB OPERATES THE FAMILY BUSINESS CENTER, A MEMBERSHIP BASED ORGANIZATION WITH PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION GEARED TO CLOSELY HELD BUSINESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CENTER RECOGNIZES THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT BENEFIT OF A TAX POSITION ONLY AFTER DETERMINING THAT THE RELEVANT TAX AUTHORITY WOULD MORE LIKELY THAN NOT SUSTAIN THE POSITION FOLLOWING AN AUDIT. FOR TAX POSITIONS MEETING THE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THRESHOLD, THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IS THE LARGEST BENEFIT THAT HAS A GREATER THAN 50% LIKELIHOOD OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT WITH THE RELEVANT TAX AUTHORITY. THE CENTER APPLIED THE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION GUIDANCE TO ALL TAX POSITIONS FOR WHICH THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS REMAINED OPEN AND DETERMINED THERE WERE NO MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021. THE CENTER DOES NOT BELIEVE THERE IS ANY UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO ITS TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD RESULT IN A MATERIAL CHANGE TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE CENTER RECOGNIZES ANY INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. THERE WERE NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAXES THAT HAVE BEEN ACCRUED OR RECOGNIZED AS OF AND FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021.
RENTAL EXPENSES NET WITH RENTAL INCOME 2,362.
RENTAL EXPENSES NET WITH RENTAL INCOME 2,362.

COMPENSATION CONTINGENT ON REVENUES OF THE ORGANIZATION: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT STAFF CAN EARN BONUS INCENTIVE COMPENSATION LARGELY BASED ON A PERCENTAGE OF THEIR BASE SALARY. ADDITIONALLY, THEY CAN EARN ADDITIONAL DOLLAR FIGURE BONUSES BASED ON PERSONAL AND TEAM PROGRAMMING SALES GOALS.

ON DECEMBER 16TH, 2021, THE ORGANIZATION SOLD THE FLUNO CENTER BUILDING AND RELATED FURNISHING AND EQUIPMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN FOUNDATION. MANAGEMENT OF THE DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS AND FUTURE HOTEL AND CONVENTION CENTER REVENUE WAS TRANSFERRED TO UW-MADISON AS PART OF THE TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VALLABH SAMBAMURTHY IS THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL OF BUSINESS. GREG DECROIX AND JAN HEIDE ARE TENURED FACULTY OF THE SCHOOL OF BUSINESS AND TECHNICALLY REPORT TO VALLABH.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARAMARK MANAGED THE DAY TO DAY OPERATION OF THE FLUNO CENTER. TOTAL PAYMENTS FOR THE YEAR WERE $67,866.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHAIR AND VICE CHAIR POSITIONS WERE ADDED TO THE BYLAWS. PARAGRAPH ADDED REGARDING CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THE DIRECTORS RESPONSIBILITIES TO ANNUALLY DISCLOSE CONFLICTS. NUMBER OF BOARD MEMBERS WAS CHANGED FROM 9-11 MEMBERS TO 9-13 MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DEAN OF THE WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF BUSINESS MAY PLACE TWO TENURED FACULTY ON THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CASB'S FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM FROM INFORMATION PREPARED AND SUBMITTED BY CASB STAFF. THE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 IS COMPLETED BY THE FINANCE & AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE REVIEW WILL BE CONDUCTED IN FEBRUARY PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION. ANNUALLY, INDIVIDUALS COVERED UNDER THE POLICY SELF IDENTIFY POTENTIAL AND/OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS. MANAGEMENT REVIEWS RESPONSES TO ENSURE ALL CONFLICTS MANAGEMENT IS AWARE OF HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED. ANNUALLY, THE BOARD REVIEWS COMPLETED RESPONSES AND DETERMINES IF ALL POTENTIAL AND/OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS ARE ACCEPTABLE. THESE DISCUSSIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES TO THE MEETING IN WHICH THEY OCCUR. AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 NO CONFLICTS WERE NOTED WHICH LIMIT ANY OFFICER, DIRECTOR, OR KEY EMPLOYEE FROM PARTICIPATING IN THE GOVERNING BODY'S DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS. SHOULD ANY POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICT ARISE BETWEEN ANNUAL SURVEYS, IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONFLICTED INDIVIDUAL, AND MANAGEMENT IF THEY ARE AWARE OF THE CONFLICT, TO BRING THE NEW CONFLICT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD TO REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, CHAIRED BY AN INDEPENDENT DIRECTOR, REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT AND OTHER OFFICERS. THIS REVIEW INCLUDES LOOKING AT COMPARABILITY DATA. THE COMMITTEE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTS ITS DISCUSSIONS AND FINAL RECOMMENDATION. COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD AND ARE ALSO CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
